posts.name: Emmanuel Perez
posts.cooked:
Hi everyone, my team and I are using the Swerve Drive Library YAGSL, we have a Limelight 3 that uses the LimeLight software (we didn’t knew well how to use photonvision), and a NAV-X- What happens is that we want to autopositionate the direction of our swerve x with the Limelight AprilTag detection, i found some documentation like this and this code .

But the problem is that they’re using the PhotonVision software or its used by a Timed Robot code, if someone has some information we haven’t seen or could guide us to implement the Limelight OS with our YAGSL code would be a great, we really apreciate you all for your help.

If you need some help pls tell us ;), thnx.

link_counts.title: Aiming and Ranging With Swerve | Limelight Documentation

posts.name: Dylan
posts.cooked:
I used limelight lib and just update the odometry in the swerve subsystem . It was pretty easy to implement.

Contribute to LimelightVision/limelightlib-wpijava development by creating an account on GitHub.

Or if you just want to lock onto the angle and not mess with odometry, you can get the tx value from the limelight, then have a drive command that uses your driver input for translation, but uses the tx value for aligning the robot.

This is what our driveAimAtTarget command does.

posts.name: Emmanuel Perez
posts.cooked:
I see in your code you have this:

What do you mean with the setRightRumbleDriver, what is that? And how do i configure my xbox controller to get the HID? Is it the POV value? Also one last question, to configure so it could detect either the apriltag below speaker at blue/left side, how do you tell it to do it?

Sorry for making some questions, its my first time programming something using vision

posts.name: Dylan
posts.cooked:
It’s an optional thing I put in out code. I designed it so if we don’t have a vision target and we are trying to align to one, it will vibrate the controller. This lets the driver know the robot can’t auto align.

I’m not sure what HID is exactly, just that I needed to get it to vibrate the controller.

Finally you can change what target you select with. SwerveSub.setVisionTargetID(aprilTagIDNum);

The docs for it is here Complete NetworkTables API | Limelight Documentation

priorityid | SET the required ID for tx/ty targeting. Ignore other targets. Does not affect localization

I still need to implement this, but you can have something that select what ID should be given based off what alliance FMS says you are on using DriverStation.getAlliance();

Something like this in the initialization of the command.

posts.name: Emmanuel Perez
posts.cooked: Thankss!!! And is there another way to activate the command with a button for example?

posts.name: Dylan
system
